technology.short_description: To raise the ragged banners above the legions can be taxing, for they may have been enchanted by other sorcerers.

effects.description: Vigour loss reduction: -15% for Zombies, Skeleton Warriors, Skeleton Spearmen and Grave Guard units

technology.short_description: There's no way a man without a mind should be able to wield a weapon effectively, but he can, with supernatural help.

effects.description: Weapon strength: +10% for Skeleton Warriors and Skeleton Spearmen

technology.short_description: When Vargheists emerge from their tomb-like cocoons, they have a great hunger - this cantrip ensures it never slakes.

effects.description: Melee defence: +5 for Vargheist units
Speed: +10% for Vargheists units

technology.short_description: Also known as the Tome of Bone, this dread volume, authored by Arkhan the Black, is filled with his secrets for instilling vigour and other deathly abilities into zombified and skeletal vessels.

effects.description: Leadership: +5 for Zombies, Skeleton Warriors, Skeleton Spearmen and Grave Guard units

technology.short_description: A single-word boon, spoken during the ritual, will harden the skin of corpses as they jerk back to life.

effects.description: Melee attack: +3 for Zombies, Skeleton Warriors and Skeleton Spearmen units
Melee defence: +3 for Zombies, Skeleton Warriors and Skeleton Spearmen units

technology.short_description: Speaking this Dark Magic mantra will bring forth yet more skeletal remains.

effects.description: Recruitment cost: -10% for Skeleton Warriors and Skeleton Spearmen units

technology.short_description: Summoning long-lost warriors to join your shambling dead boosts the yearning hordes' capable champions.

effects.description: Recruit rank: +2 for Skeletal and Zombie units

technology.short_description: For centuries, this tome of beasts has been required reading for Necromancers who wish ultimate control, training and mastery of the dread creatures that lurk by the graveside.

effects.description: Leadership: +5 for Dire Wolves and Fell Bats units

technology.short_description: The darker and more haunted the forests become, the better the habitat for fell creatures.

effects.description: Upkeep: -10% for Fell Bats and Dire Wolves units
Recruitment cost: -10% for Fell Bats and Dire Wolves units

technology.short_description: Contained in this passage of De Noirot's tome are methods of usurping the alpha beast of the pack.

effects.description: Weapon strength: +5% for Dire Wolves units
Speed: +10% for Dire Wolves units

technology.short_description: There are words of power to control Vampires that have been lost to the bestial side hidden within them.

effects.description: Upkeep: -10% for Varghulf and Vargheists units
Recruitment cost: -10% for Varghulf and Vargheists units

technology.short_description: A fresh supply of meat or at least knowledge of where to find it, usually some poor Sylvanian hamlet, keeps these beasts pliant.

effects.description: Armour: +10 for Varghulf units
Weapon strength: +5% for Varghulf units

technology.short_description: A Terrorgheist feeds by terrifying its prey into paralysis, this invocation invigorates the monster further.

effects.description: Weapon strength: +5% for Terrorgheist units
Melee attack: +5 for Terrorgheist units
Charge bonus: +20% for Terrorgheist units

technology.short_description: Blessed be the ties that bind, for they shall last forever.

effects.description: Recruitment cost: -20% for Zombies units

technology.short_description: The armour many soldiers are buried with is brought back to the surface - a gift from the grave.

effects.description: Armour: +10 for Skeleton Warriors and Skeleton Spearmen units

technology.short_description: A small cantrip can locate ancient blades upon an ancient battlefield long thought lost to time.

effects.description: Weapon strength: +10% for Grave Guard and Black Knights units

technology.short_description: To become Master of Swarms is to dominate each creature within the flock, so they sway to his control.

effects.description: Armour-piercing weapon damage: +1 for Fell Bats units
Armour: +20 for Fell Bats units
Melee defence: +5 for Fell Bats units

technology.short_description: Beasts that are already blooded, that know the thrill of hunting living things, will always be the superior breed.

effects.description: Recruit rank: +2 for all units from the Forest building chain

technology.short_description: The coming of death isn't necessarily a disadvantage, and can even prove the most special of boons.

effects.description: Armour: +10 for Zombies units

technology.short_description: Guided by Arkhan's text, the Necromancer enters the barrows he plunders, invoking ancient curses as he goes.

effects.description: Upkeep: -100% for Skeleton Warriors and Skeleton Spearmen

technology.short_description: The dread animator can wake the most stubborn of ancient warriors from their deathly slumber.

effects.description: Upkeep: -10% for Grave Guard and Black Knights units
Recruitment cost: -10% for Grave Guard and Black Knights units
Armour: +5 for Grave Guard and Black Knights units

technology.short_description: Contained within, the secrets of holding together - quite literally - a rotting horde of Zombies.

effects.description: Upkeep: -100% for Zombies units

technology.short_description: Bestial chants around fell markings, eating their own, ghoulish kind.

effects.description: Weapon strength: +10% for Crypt Ghouls and Crypt Horrors units
Speed: +5% for Crypt Ghoul and Crypt Horror units

technology.short_description: The book implants racial memories of Mourkain, Ushoran and Kadon to haunt the creatures' waking dreams.

effects.description: Recruit rank: +2 for Crypt Ghouls and Crypt Horrors units

technology.short_description: To enshrine an Ancient Lord of the Horde is to show the mortals just how fragile their own petty lives are.

effects.description: Attrition: -30% casualties suffered from non-Vampiric territory attrition
Raise dead cost: -5%

technology.short_description: As the industry of Undeath grows, so do the dwellings of its Dark Lords. It is blood that drives this dread economy.

effects.description: Income from cities: +15%
Growth: +15

technology.short_description: Defeated mortal Knights who fought valiantly are, on occasion, granted the Blood Kiss.

effects.description: Melee attack: +5 for Blood Knight units
Melee defence: +5 for Blood Knight units
Charge bonus: +15% for Blood Knight units

technology.short_description: Returning to the sanctuary of his Black Coach, the Vampire will begin the Lahmian art of rebirth.

effects.description: Armour: +15 for Black Coach, Corpse Cart, and Mortis Engine units
Charge bonus: +10% for Black Coach, Corpse Cart, and Mortis Engine units

technology.short_description: As its dark empire rots, the Midnight Aristocracy clings to pride and the fineries of nobility ever more strongly.

effects.description: Upkeep: -5% for Black Coach, Corpse Cart, Mortis Engine, and Blood Knight units
Recruitment cost: -5% for Black Coach, Corpse Cart, Mortis Engine, and Blood Knight units
Recruit rank: +2 for Black Coach, Corpse Cart, Mortis Engine, and Blood Knight units

technology.short_description: A text of powerful binding and one of the nine Books of Nagash. It contains countless rituals to ensnare wrathful spirits, summon ghoulish creatures and imbue such fell things with dread power.

effects.description: Attrition: -20% casualties suffered from non-Vampiric territory attrition

technology.short_description: Ushoran was the first Ghoul King; his spirit can be invoked with the right words, and his children summoned.

effects.description: Upkeep: -10% for Crypt Ghouls and Crypt Horrors units
Recruitment cost: -10% for Crypt Ghouls and Crypt Horrors units

technology.short_description: This incantation quickens the pace of the hordes over great distances. Forever marching, never tiring.

effects.description: Campaign movement range: +10%

technology.short_description: The enemy should fear the war engines of the dead, as screaming skulls fly over the ramparts!

effects.description: Leadership: +10 when laying siege
Leadership: +10 when under siege
Enemy siege holdout time: -1 (minimum 1 turn)

technology.short_description: Said to be transcribed from scrolls of Neferata herself, this grave codex instructs recently-sired Vampires in the art of infiltrating, influencing and spreading the Vampiric curse across the world.

effects.description: Blood Kiss gained: 1

technology.onscreen_name: Serve in Life or in Death
technology.short_description: Fear is a great motivator. The living within the captured settlement must appease their new lord.

effects.description: Growth: +10
Income from Repression buildings: +15%

technology.short_description: The Vampires' baleful rituals are enacted to ensure the spread of Undeath.

effects.description:
Vampiric corruption: +2
	(factionwide)

technology.short_description: The tenets of Lahmia encourage Vampires to inveigle themselves into the mortal populace.

effects.description:
Vampiric corruption in adjacent provinces: +1
	(all provinces)

technology.short_description: As a Vampire grows in dark majesty, others of evil intent will flock to this master, for they also crave power.

effects.description: Hero recruit rank: +2 for Vampires
Hero recruit rank: +2 for Necromancers

technology.short_description: Pulling all the strings, his puppets are willing tools, ready to be used at their master's command.

effects.description: [HIDDEN - do not translate] Used to increase lord rank when replacing a lord (target the effect at forces factionwide) - use in conjunction with a shown effect that targets provinces factionwide
Lord recruit rank: +2
Leadership: +10 for Lords and embedded Heroes
Hero action cost: -33%
Hero recruitment cost: -33%

technology.short_description: Using a litany from a language not spoken for generations, the speaker can bind malevolent spirits to his cause.

effects.description: Upkeep: -10% for Cairn Wraiths and Hexwraiths units
Recruitment cost: -10% for Cairn Wraiths and Hexwraiths units

technology.short_description: Behold the reapers - summoned from their cairns to enact the doom of all mortals!

effects.description: Weapon strength: +15% for Cairn Wraiths and Hexwraiths units

technology.short_description: Shackling Wraiths via arcane means keeps their spirits tethered longer to the mortal plane.

effects.description: Recruit rank: +2 for Cairn Wraiths and Hexwraiths units

technology.short_description: Witching Night is the best time for ritual sacrifice, for evil gods are awaiting such gifts at year's turn.

effects.description: Hero recruit rank: +2 for Wight Kings
Hero recruit rank: +2 for Banshees
Income from Vengeful Spirit buildings: +30%

technology.short_description: Some Vampires are masters of disguise, using their charm and magic to infiltrate powerful organisations and noble houses.

effects.description: Diplomatic relations: +10 with all factions

technology.short_description: The Book of Blood contains indexes and lexiconic keys for deciphering ancient manuscripts said to hold true power.

effects.description: Income from Forbidden Libraries and Necromancer's Towers: +30%

technology.short_description: The darkest chapters within these pages are the incantations of Nagash, rituals that only the most powerful Vampires dare attempt.

effects.description: Income from Vampire Crypts and Vampire Keeps: +30%
